Transcript:
Stephen's voice: When someone's sent 
back to earth from upstairs like you were, downstairs gets to do likewise, 
even-steven, so to speak. So when you traded in your halo for the woman you 
love, let's just say I got a "get out of hell free" card.

Rafe: I thought me coming back here 
was some sort of reward, you know, for me and Alison, for our love for each 
other, for our faith in each other. I didn't know evil got a free ride back with 
me. I mean, what kind of cosmic balance is that?

Rafe: How am I going to give you the 
life of your dreams and still get rid of our biggest nightmare?

Alison: Hi. There you are. So, what do 
you think?

Rafe: I think it's perfect. I think 
you're perfect.

Alison: I wanted tonight to be really 
special for us.

Rafe: And I just want to say thank you 
for making every night very special.
Alison: Merry Christmas Eve.
Rafe: Merry Christmas Eve to you, too.
Alison: And merry almost wedding day.
Rafe: Even better.

Alison: So, here's to the rest of our 
very happy, glorious, normal lives together.

Ian (to Eve's grave): Merry Christmas, 
Eve. There's no place we'd rather be than right here with you.

Kevin: Hi. I was just going to put 
some more gifts under the tree. Guess you did some more last-minute shopping, 
huh?

Lucy: Yeah, there were just a few 
things I wanted to pick up for the girls.
Kevin: Lucy --
Lucy: I'm going to take a shower now.
Kevin: Can we just talk for a minute?

Lucy: No, I -- no, I don't. I still 
can't picture it. I just can't picture you standing there and acting so 
surprised when that woman agreed to drop all the assault charges and agreed to 
leave town.

Kevin: I thought you of all people 
would understand.

Lucy: Understand what? That it's ok to 
pay off somebody and then lie so easily to me about it?

Kevin: No. Because I didn't want our 
life to be blown apart again. Lucy, it's not like I hurt anyone.
Lucy: You did. That woman got hurt.
Kevin: No.
Lucy: She almost died!

Kevin: But not because of me. How 
could I know what would happen?
Lucy: I --

Kevin: You know what, Lucy? What I'm 
most sorry about is that your trust in me has been broken. But can't we find a 
way to get past that, just for tonight? It's Christmas Eve.

Lucy: Somehow I'm having a really hard 
time getting into the Christmas spirit.

Tess: Thank you. It's beautiful. And 
-- and thank you for last night.

Jack: Yeah. It was pretty amazing, 
huh?
Tess: For me, too.

Jack: Hmm. Now do you know how real 
you are to me? You're your own person, Tess, separate from Livvie.
[Doorbell rings]

Jack: Ah. Well, I think our guests are 
here. I'll be back.
Livvie: Merry Christmas, everyone.
Jack: What do you think you're doing?
Livvie: I'm moving in with my sister.

[Captioning made possible by abc, 
inc.]
Livvie: Hi, Tess. Take that.

Jack: Livvie, there's no way in hell 
you're moving in here.

Livvie: Tess and I have a bond, Jack. 
We need to watch out for each other like family.
Jack: Yeah, well, you're not family.
[Doorbell rings]
Jack: Don't get comfortable.

Livvie: Tess, you have to convince 
Jack to let me stay because now that we know Caleb created you from me, we know 
that we are a part of each other.
Tess: But I want to be my own person.

Livvie: Yeah, I want that, too. But 
right now we know if something happens to one of us, it happens to the both of 
us, so we need to, you know, keep each other safe.
Jamal: What's Livvie doing here?

Jack: She wants to be Tess' keeper, 
but I'm not going to let that happen.

Livvie: I have a Christmas present for 
you in the car. I'll be right back, ok?
Jack: Hey, are you ok?

Tess: I want her to move in, Jack, 
please?

Jack: Oh, Tess. I thought we talked 
about this.

Tess: Look, I know you don't like her, 
but I want a chance to get close to her, too.

Jack: You don't need Livvie. You're 
your own person.

Tess: No, we need each other. Jack, 
please, didn't you tell me that Christmas is the time to forgive and when people 
should be together?

Alison: One year I convinced Nana to 
let me open up every single gift on Christmas Eve. Hey.
Rafe: Hmm.
Alison: Rafe.
Rafe: Hi.
Alison: What's wrong??
Rafe: Nothing.

Alison: Don't be like that. Tell me. I 
can see it in your face.
Rafe: No, it's nothing.
Alison: What's going on?
Rafe: It's nothing.
Alison: Talk to me.

Rafe: Look, I think tonight is 
amazing. Everything about tonight is amazing, and I consider myself the luckiest 
person in the world, just to be sitting with you here right now. And even 
luckier that I'm going to get to marry you. But I'm just a little worried, you 
know, that I won't be able to protect you and I won't be able to give you the 
life you deserve and --
Alison: You already have.

Rafe: Yeah, but -- here's the thing -- 
this world is not always good.

Alison: Well, I know that, but I think 
that sometimes you just have to have faith, you know? Especially on a night like 
tonight. Trust me, and I think this is going to be a very special Christmas Eve 
-- a night to always remember. Hmm?
[Alison giggles]

Lucy: I can't just suddenly pretend 
everything's ok with us.
Kevin: Well, it'll take some time.

Lucy: It's not -- it's not time. Time 
isn't the thing here. It's you. It's the way you talked to that woman, the 
things you said, and the things you said to me -- that everybody has a price and 
everybody can be bought. The way you said that, it scared me.

Kevin: I just wanted you to understand 
how much you mean to me and that I don't want us to be separated again.

Lucy: Don't you see what -- it's like 
you've separated us even further.

Serena: Look, there's even more 
presents underneath the Christmas tree.
Christina: Yippee!
Serena: Hooray!

Lucy: Wait a minute. It's not quite 
Christmas time. Put those down. Come on!

Serena: But we can't sleep. Can we 
stay up later tonight, please?
Lucy: No. No, no, no.
Christina: Read me a Christmas story.
[Serena laughs]

Kevin: Uh -- ok. What would you like 
to hear?
Christina: The story of you and mommy.
Kevin: Ok. Which one?

Christina: The Christmas one, when you 
became my mommy and daddy.

Serena: That's right. It was a year 
ago tonight. We got back Christina and you guys got married.
Kevin: You know, you're right, it was.

Christina: Tell about how you loved us 
so much that you made us a family.

Kevin: This was the most beautiful 
Christmas party I had ever seen. It was like a perfect winter wonderland. You 
know what? Your mommy - she kept avoiding me. She kept running through the crowd 
like a running back at a football game.

Serena: Hmm. But you finally caught 
her.

Kevin: And I asked her to take a huge 
leap of faith with me. Do you trust me enough to believe that I love you and I 
always will? It's up to you. I'm asking, yes or no? Will you marry me?
Serena: And she said yes.

Kevin: And then the best part of the 
whole night -- right before we said "I do" --
Christina: That's when I came!
Lucy: Christina?

Kevin: Merry Christmas. That was the 
most beautiful sight I'd ever seen. I thought I would just burst when I was 
watching her. And right then and there, I knew there was only one thing in my 
life that I wanted -- I wanted to make my family happy.
Serena: And how did you feel, mom?

Lucy: I felt so lucky. I was thinking 
that this was everything I ever wanted in my life. I had the man that I love to 
marry, and I had you, and I got my Christina back, and I was surrounded by my 
daughters and my husband and all our family and friends.

Christina: Why not tonight, mommy? 
Where's Ian and Danny?

Ian: There you go. What do you think? 
It's pretty good, right? Oh, I know. It's not as nice as the one down in the 
park. You should see that thing, Eve. It's gorgeous.
[Danny coos]

Ian: Big as a house. It's going to 
light up the whole sky. I know it will. Some of the patients in the hospital say 
that they look out the window and they see it, it makes them feel like the 
holidays, even if they're not with their families. I know what they mean. I just 
wish, you know, I -- I wish I could give the boy more of a family, not just this 
grumpy old dad, you know? He's good friends with Christina, and I think Serena 
likes watching him, but I kind of screwed that one up, too. I screwed up a lot 
of things since you've been gone. But I'll give him a good Christmas.
[Danny coos]
Ian: I promise you.

Jack: I talked to Tess. She wants you 
to stay.

Livvie: Well, I'm not surprised. I 
know you don't like it, Jack, but we are connected.

Jack: Save it, Livvie. I don't trust 
you.
[Music plays]
Tess: Hi, Chris.
Chris: Hey. It's good to see you.
Tess: I'm really glad you're here.

Chris: Well, me, too, me, too. You 
know, I've been thinking a lot about you, the way you heal people on the inside 
and out. You know, you're a real miracle worker.

Tess: I just wish there wasn't so many 
hurt people.

Chris: Yeah, I know. Me, too. Listen, 
you know, is there anything I can do for you? You know, I don't want you to 
worry about anyone else right now, you know? How about the headaches? Have they 
gone away?
Tess: Better.

Chris: Good. Well, it's Christmas. How 
about a wish? Anything you want, anything. Just let me know.

Tess: Well, all I want is everyone to 
be together and to love each other tonight.

Marissa: You know, my mom still can't 
stop talking about you.

Jamal: Oh, whatever. You know, joke 
all you want, ok, but it really is -- it's big to me that you stuck around for 
the holidays, because I know how you like big family Christmases and everything.

Marissa: Yeah, I do, but I'll be there 
next year, and maybe you'll be there with me.
Jamal: Well, I think I'd like that.
Marissa: Yeah.

Livvie: Well, merry Christmas, Tess. 
Go ahead, open it.
Tess: Ok.

Livvie: I have one just like it, and I 
didn't know what to get you, and I figured if I liked it, then you would 
probably like it.
Tess: It's beautiful. Thank you.

Jamal: So, now she's got them dressing 
alike? Isn't that kind of freaky?

Jack: Yeah, everything about Livvie is 
freaky. But Tess wants her in her life, wants to be close to her.
Livvie: Thank you.
Tess: Thank you.

Alison: Remember last year, how we 
helped everybody get back together?

Rafe: Yeah. Wow, that seems like a 
long time ago.

Alison: Doesn't it? That's just my 
point. See, everybody has their problems, but I think that it's love that gets 
you through that, and it's what's gotten us through this past year.
Rafe: Oh, wow. You're right.
Alison: I am? I am?

Rafe: You are so right. You make me so 
happy. I just, you know -- I'm done playing this little mind trip on myself. 
Let's talk about something else. Let's -- my favorite subject -- let's talk 
about you.

Alison: Ok. Are you ready for some 
good news?
Rafe: Absolutely, anytime.

Alison: Ok, the private investigator 
that we hired dropped off a trunk that belonged to my father.
Rafe: And? What was in it? What was --

Alison: There were some documents and 
some letters and a photograph of the woman that we've been looking for -- the 
woman who is the mother of my brother or sister.
Rafe: That's great.
Alison: Isn't that awesome?
Rafe: That's great.
Alison: Isn't that cool?

Rafe: You're one step closer. It's 
amazing.

Alison: I know. I know. It's weird. 
It's like -- it's like everything's coming together. You know, ever since I was 
a little kid, I've always dreamt of this, and especially the part about marrying 
you. Oh, which brings me to my next thing.
Rafe: What?
Alison: I have a wedding gift for you.

Rafe: Oh. Well, I hope, you know -- 
you're going to have to wait until tomorrow for yours.
Alison: That's fine.

Rafe: I mean, you're not going to scam 
it out of me early.

Alison: That's fine, that's fine, 
that's fine.
Rafe: Ok.
Rafe: Whoa.
Alison: Do you like it? It's a watch.
Rafe: Thanks. Wow, I --

Alison: I always used to get so upset 
about your other watch, because I knew that every time I looked at I it would 
remind me that you would have to leave.

Rafe: Wow. That's great. So it's just 
a regular watch with no countdown, no stopping?

Alison: No. And it will tell time 
forever, because it's solar powered. And it will never die, just like our love.

Rafe: Well, this is -- it's beautiful. 
I love it. I -- man, I love you.

Alison: It's to remind you that we are 
together now and our time is endless. And it's also to remind you to stop 
worrying, because we're together now and everything is going to be just fine, 
ok? What was that?
Rafe: The power went out everywhere.

Alison: I know, except for that light 
over there.

Rafe: It's weird. It's just in that 
one spot. Everything else is out.

Alison: I know. It's really bright, 
though.

Rafe: Tell you what, I'm going to see 
what its, but I don't want to leave you here alone.

Alison: Well, I'll just -- I'll come 
with you.
Rafe: Oh, ok. Let's go.
Alison: Ok.

Ian: Looks like we lost some lights. 
Huh. Power's out everywhere.
Ian: Except for over there.
Serena: Whoa.

Lucy: Oh, there's just one bright 
light over there.
Kevin: Well, how can that be?

Serena: Can we go and see what it is, 
mom? Please?
Lucy: Well, it's cold -- yeah.
Serena: Please? Come on.
Lucy: Ok, ok, ok.
Serena: Yes!

Lucy: But go get your coats and get 
your shoes.
Serena: Come on.

Lucy: Be careful. I'll get some 
candles.
Serena: Whoo-hoo!
Jack: Here, Tess. Wow.
Marissa: This is amazing.

Chris: There's no way that should be 
working.
Jamal: Looks like it's working to me.
Jack: Well, Merry Christmas, Tess.
Tess: Merry Christmas, Jack.
Frank: Can you believe this?

Ian: No. I guess your mom thought we 
needed a little reminder, huh? It's right there, right there with you.
[Danny coos]

Alison: This is so beautiful. Rafe, 
this was the Christmas spirit I was talking about.
Jamal: Ali, Rafe. What's up?
Serena: It's a miracle.
Lucy: Wow.
Kevin: Well, you can say that again.
Christina: Miracle!

Ian: Look at that. It's your friend 
Christina.
Ian: Amazing. Merry Christmas.
Kevin: Yeah, Merry Christmas.

Alison: Rafe, this is what I think 
everybody really wanted, was to be together on Christmas Eve.

Rafe: I guess you're right all along. 
I just needed a night like this to show me.

Alison: Yeah, I think we all needed a 
little reminder.

Rafe: Merry Christmas, my soon-to-be 
wife.
Alison: Merry Christmas. Thank you.

All: We wish you a Merry Christmas, we 
wish you a Merry Christmas we wish you a Merry Christmas and a happy New Year. 
Good tidings we bring to you and your kin. Good tidings for Christmas and a 
happy New Year. We wish you a Merry Christmas, we wish you a Merry Christmas, we 
wish you a Merry Christmas and a happy New Year!
On the next "Port Charles" --

Elizabeth: I can have it all, thanks 
to you. But you know what that feels like, don't you, Stephen? To have one 
person be your whole world.

Livvie: The one man for me is back to 
stay.
Tess: Caleb?
Livvie: Caleb.
